intro: Campanula glomerata var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features basal rosettes of lance-shaped, hairy leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along stream banks. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms and ease of care.
